intro: Nectandra ambigens, commonly known as the ambiguous sandarac, is a tropical tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Lauraceae, which includes laurels and cinnamon trees. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves and small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. Its sap is a viscous resin that has been historically used in traditional medicine and as a natural adhesive. The tree typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical rainforests.
